: Okay, so. You're dead, but you can play a Game to return back to life.
: Right now, you're in the Shibuyan Underground, which is a different plane than the Realground. The Realground is where living people live. The Underground is where Players and Reapers live.
: Players are stuck in the Underground. Realgrounders can't see into the Underground unless they're in specially decaled shops. So they don't know you're there.
: A Player is a dead human who's got a chance to come back to life an' who will play the Game.

: Reapers are also dead humans, but we're like... special dead humans. Magic ones. Reapers can go into the Realground and be seen and lead relatively normal lives. In the Underground, we can also fly, teleport, summon monsters called Noise, and turn into Noise ourselves. Stuff like that.
: I see... S-sorry, this has nothing to do with any of that, but... these are very delicious.
: Yay! I'm glad.

: Reapers were Players once too. F'r example, I played in the last Game run in this district. I won, so I chose to be a Reaper. Most Reapers didn't choose this-- they would have been erased if they didn't become a Reaper after losing their partner.
: In the Game, you'll have to survive for seven days.
: You'll get a set of magic pins that'll help you fight monsters called Noise. Each day, you'll have to complete a mission given by the Game Master. There are also boss battles with really big Noise.
: This seems complicated, but... you still managed to win, so... I suppose I should say congratulations?
beams! "It's complicated, but there's a tutorial on the day before the Game, and you can always ask a Reaper for help. It makes lots more sense once you're actually playing."
